Package app

Class DialogBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.HBox
              • app.DialogBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class DialogBox
extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox
    The `DialogBox` class represents a graphical dialog box in the Duke chatbot application. It contains a label for displaying text and an image for displaying an avatar or profile picture. This class is designed to work with JavaFX and is used for both user and Duke's messages in the conversation.
    Version:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    raydenlim

    • Method Detail

      • getUserDialog

        public static DialogBox getUserDialog​(java.lang.String text,
                                      javafx.scene.image.Image img)
        Creates and returns a `DialogBox` for the user's message with the specified text and image.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the user's message.
        img - The image representing the user.
        Returns:
        A `DialogBox` for the user's message.

      • getDukeDialog

        public static DialogBox getDukeDialog​(java.lang.String text,
                                      javafx.scene.image.Image img)
        Creates and returns a `DialogBox` for Duke's message with the specified text and image. The dialog box is flipped to display Duke's message on the left and the image on the right.
        Parameters:
        text - The text of Duke's message.
        img - The image representing Duke.
        Returns:
        A flipped `DialogBox` for Duke's message.
